head.title: District Planning and Implementation Resources for COVID-19 – COVID-19 – Tyrrell County Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Tyrell County School District is located in Columbia, NC.

img.h1: District Planning and Implementation Resources for COVID-19

img.style: float: right; padding: 10px; margin-left: inherit; margin-right: inherit; display: block

em.span: The safety of our students and staff is our top priority. We will provide updates and resources in an effort to help families reduce the risk in their home and community.
Interim Guidance for Administrators of US K-12 Schools and Childcare Programs: Plan, Prepare, and Respond to Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
Tyrrell County Schools Continuity of Learning

span.em: We are prepared to transition from the classroom to remote learning, to move teaching and learning beyond the four walls of the classroom for all of our students. Our instructional staff have the skills needed for providing instruction to our students within a remote environment.
Tyrrell County Schools can provide you (parent) and your child with access to your child's current grades and attendance via the internet.

img.style: float: left; padding: 10px; margin-left: inherit; margin-right: inherit

span.em: These resources shared are to assist in finding effective instructional material. Some of these resources are typically a paid subscription but have been opened specifically in response to the COVID-19 outbreak. This is not a comprehensive list - the page will be updated with new resources and monitored for changes as they are necessary.

img.style: float: left; padding: 10px; margin-left: inherit; margin-right: inherit

a.em: NC Office of Early Learning: Parent Resources to Support Learning For Children Birth-Grade 2

div.em: In an effort to support families and teachers, the resources linked below have been created to provide weekly learning activities that do not require technology and are aligned to NC standards. Resources are organized by age and grade level. Knowing that children develop and learn at different rates please don't hesitate to look at resources outside of your child's age or grade level. Weekly resources will continue to be added each Friday. Please check back for more!

span.em: While we make the temporary transition from the classroom to remote learning, we are happy to share that our School Nutrition Services team has a plan to provide meals to all students as well as any child through 18 years of age.

Tyrrell County Schools will provide meals by utilizing our school buses to provide breakfast and lunch, starting Monday, March 16, 2020. Our district buses will operate by running regular school routes leaving campus at 8:00am, each morning in an effort to provide meals to our students.
We will also operate a district feeding site, which will be housed at Columbia High School, during the following hours:
***Please note that the Tyrrell County Schools Feeding Program will not be in service during Spring Break, which begins Friday, April 10 and goes through the following week.***

img.style: padding: 10px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; float: none
img.alt: TCS Feeding Program Closed during Spring Break

img.style: padding: 10px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; display: block; float: none

div.div: Click here to access the new Parent & Family FAQ webpage which was added to the COVID-19 Response & Resources website. New questions will be added to this page as they are received and vetted for accuracy.

div.br: The new page also allows parents and families the opportunity to view a video series with our own Deputy State Superintendents Bev Emory and David Stegall responding to some of the most frequently asked questions. These videos are released through social media daily between 8:00 a.m. and 9:00 a.m. A special thanks to Elaine Darby, NCDPI Web Marketing Specialist for leading this project!

div.strong: Will My High School Senior Graduate This Spring?
div.br: How the statewide school closure due to COVID-19 will impact seniors scheduled to graduate this spring.

div.strong: Where Can Teachers and Parents Find Online Instructional Resources?
div.br: Guidance on where to find online resources to help teachers and parents provide instruction to students.

div.strong: Does My Child Have to Complete the Work Assigned by the School?
div.br: Discussion on why it's important for students to complete school work assigned by teachers.

div.strong: What Do I Do If I Don’t Have a Computer or Internet Access?
div.br: Options for families who don’t have online access, guidance on who to ask for assistance and a discussion about innovative and creative ways school and community organizations are working together to bring computers and internet access to families.

div.strong: How Do I Find Locations in My Area That are Serving School Meals?
div.br: Resources to help parents find locations across the state that are serving school meals.

div.strong: When Will Students Return to School? How Will That Decision Be Made?
div.br: Discussion of date students may return to school and the process state education leaders used to determine that date.

div.div: You can see additional FAQs on the NCDPI YouTube Channel.

img.style: float: left; padding: 10px; margin-left: inherit; margin-right: inherit

span.img: Exceptional Children Information for Parents Newsletter 3/26/2020

a.span: SPANISH Exceptional Children Information for Parents Newsletter 3/26/2020

span.em: With information changing daily, we encourage families to stay up to date on information regarding COVID-19 and protect yourself and the community.

div.span: Talking to Children About COVID-19 (Coronavirus): A Parent Resource
